testCaseDescription: Validate repository visibility is reflected after creation

testSteps.Step_Desc: 1. Login to GitHub with valid credentials. [Test Data- Email: valid@email.com, Password: validPassword] [Acceptance Criteria- AC-2]
testSteps.Expected_Result: Repository visibility is displayed as selected (Public/Private) after creation.

testSteps.Step_Desc: 2. Click on 'New repository' button. [Test Data- N/A] [Acceptance Criteria- AC-2]
testSteps.Expected_Result: Repository visibility is displayed as selected (Public/Private) after creation.

testSteps.Step_Desc: 3. Enter repository name, description, and select visibility as 'Public'. [Test Data- Repository Name: new-repo, Description: Test repo, Visibility: Public] [Acceptance Criteria- AC-2]
testSteps.Expected_Result: Repository visibility is displayed as selected (Public/Private) after creation.

testSteps.Step_Desc: 4. Click on 'Create repository' button. [Test Data- N/A] [Acceptance Criteria- AC-2]
testSteps.Expected_Result: Repository visibility is displayed as selected (Public/Private) after creation.

testSteps.Step_Desc: 5. Verify that the newly created repository is marked as 'Public'. [Test Data- Repository Name: new-repo] [Acceptance Criteria- AC-2]
testSteps.Expected_Result: Repository visibility is displayed as selected (Public/Private) after creation.

testSteps.Step_Desc: 6. Repeat steps 3-5 with visibility set to 'Private'. [Test Data- Repository Name: new-repo-private, Description: Test repo, Visibility: Private] [Acceptance Criteria- AC-2]
testSteps.Expected_Result: Repository visibility is displayed as selected (Public/Private) after creation.
